[SYNTAX]: Overly complex sentence structures with multiple nested clauses (e.g., "The feathers of which this...").
[LEXICON]: Archaic vocabulary ("wonted devotion", "revelry") and formal tone may hinder modern readability.

[TRANSITION]: Abrupt shifts between descriptive vignettes (e.g., from Pali description to Bishop Museum without clear connective tissue).
[STRUCTURE]: Non-sequential inclusion of anecdotal details (e.g., Napoleon quote) that disrupt narrative flow.

[LEXICON]: Wordy phrasing ("excessive disagreeableness of the feeling")
[SYNTAX]: Cumbersome sentence structure (e.g., lengthy lists without clear pauses)

[STRUCTURE]: Abrupt transition from personal discomfort to historical description
[TRANSITION]: Lack of clear connection between paragraphs (e.g., bridge scene to notice posting)
